I went to the Shishi grave=
yard, where the end result of a lot of 
Shinsengumi handiwork ended up.  Vi=
sited Sakamoto Ryoma and Nakaoka 
Shintaro's grave (and added a pebble to t=
he collection), and Kido 
Takayoshi's (Kouin) grave as well. Also visited t=
he bakumatsu museum 
nearby, but was sort of underwhelmed.  It did have Kon=
do Isami's 
chainmail and the sword that Saigo Takamori used to kill himsel=
f, but 
beyond that, there wasn't a lot to see. Also, there was a painting =
of 
Kondo Isami's severed head by a Choshu samurai who painted it while 
it=
 was sitting exposed by Sanjo bridge.  Kondo didn't look too happy 
about h=
is fate.
